metadata.Title: CVE-2022-45416 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Keyboard events reference strings like "KeyA" that were at fixed, known, and widely-spread addresses. Cache-based timing attacks such as Prime+Probe could have possibly figured out which keys were being pressed. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.5, Thunderbird < 102.5, and Firefox < 107.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-45416` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '107.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
